title: (x) Pride & Prejudice movie poster title - H&FJ Requiem {Alessandro (self), Patricia}
content:
[http://typophile.com/node/18094](http://web.archive.org/web/20071117073855/http:/typophile.com/node/18094 "http://typophile.com/node/18094")

Hi again, the display face on the sides of ‘&’ is not HF Requiem as I thought, is it a Bembo of some sort ?

 [‹ (x) Philip Lelei square sans - Agency Gothic {Yves}](http://web.archive.org/web/20071117073855/http:/typophile.com/node/18116 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) flare serif "Allegro" - TF Arrow {Tiff} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071117073855/http:/typophile.com/node/18102 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Alessandro Segalini

comments.content: The ampersand is also Bernhard Modern.

Is this movie a remake?

ChrisL

Yes, it’s a [remake](http://web.archive.org/web/20071117073855/http:/www.imdb.com/title/tt0414387/) based on the same Jane Austen novel. The original was made in [1940](http://web.archive.org/web/20071117073855/http:/www.imdb.com/title/tt0032943/).

That said, I haven’t seen the latest. :)

The Greer Garson one was the one I remember. There was also a TV (BBC?) version done about 10 years ago.  
Thanks Geoff!

ChrisL
I think it is Requiem, just with a horsey stroke added.

The ampersand is also Bernhard Modern.

We knew that... ;^P
Yes. I didn’t read his whole question. :^( My bad.
